meanings.definition: To make a slight, tremulous sound.
meanings.sent1: The leaves dindle in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the coins dindle in his pocket as he walked.
meanings.sent3: The raindrops dindle softly on the windowpane.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to dindle through the room like a delicate melody.
meanings.sent5: The distant chimes dindle in the quiet evening air.

meanings.definition: To waste time in a trifling way.
meanings.sent1: Stop dindling and finish your homework.
meanings.sent2: He tends to dindle away his weekends watching TV.
meanings.sent3: She always finds ways to dindle when there are chores to be done.
meanings.sent4: Don't dindle your opportunities away with procrastination.
meanings.sent5: Time seems to dindle when you're having fun.

meanings.definition: A slight trembling or tremulous sound.
meanings.sent1: The dindle of the distant thunder could be heard.
meanings.sent2: The old house was filled with the dindle of mice scurrying.
meanings.sent3: The dindle of the wind in the trees created a soothing background noise.
meanings.sent4: The dindle of the waterfall echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The soft dindle of the stream was calming to listen to.
